comments.body: @martin-badin looks like removing the displayTransforem and regex parameters would be a breaking change. Is this something that new version no longer supports or is this accidental??

I did some checking and this was the signature last [as of react-mentions v2.4.2](https://github.com/signavio/react-mentions/blob/v2.4.2/src/utils.js#L161) and the new signature was introduced in v3.0.0 with signavio/react-mentions#308. So I /think/ technically the types version is correct and this signature was just busted for v3.x version before.

However, since there are so many updates, and react-mentions is at v4.x now, I'm wondering if we shouldn't go ahead and [bump the major version of this types package](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped#if-a-library-is-updated-to-a-new-major-version-with-breaking-changes-how-should-i-update-its-type-declaration-package) to v4.1 (or the oldest version you're confidence these types are compatible with). I think you can just update [the major.minor version number listed in the first line of the index.d.ts file](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/3ea27f607b34b9bab74940348292c7fffaf3b0b4/types/react-mentions/index.d.ts#L1) from this:

> // Type definitions for react-mentions 3.3

to this

> // Type definitions for react-mentions 4.1

Let me know your thoughts!
And in looking back at the beginning of this PR, since we added `a11ySuggestionsListLabel` I think we should bump this to v4.1.
